content.title: Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia
content.department: Agriculture & Cooperation Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Family members of deceased farmers/tenant farmers
content.details: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 7,00,000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons.
benefits: Counseling and support from government officials
Priority access to other government schemes for rehabilitation
eligibility: Family member of a deceased farmer/tenant farmer
Resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh
content.application_process: The application process involves contacting the Collectorate through a helpline.
documents_required: Documentary evidence of lease (for tenant farmers)
Revenue Records or Crop Cultivators Rights Card (CCRC) if applicable

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That The Family Of The Deceased Farmer Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 7,00,000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers.

faqs.question: Which Reasons Can Be Considered Agrarian Reasons For Suicide?
faqs.answer: The reasons can include failure of bore wells, raising of commercial crops with high cost of cultivation, non-remunerative prices, oral tenancy, ineligibility to avail of bank loans, private lending with higher interest rates, adverse seasonal conditions, heavy expenditure incurred towards children's education, ill health, and marriages.

faqs.question: How Is The Term “Farmer” Defined For The Purpose Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The term 'farmer' shall include every person who derives substantial livelihood from farming, not limited to those with title to land, but including tenant farmers and women farmers.

faqs.question: In Whose Bank Account Can The Amount Of The Financial Assistance Be Disbursed?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary of the financial assistance should be a family member of the deceased farmer.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of The Helpline In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The helpline allows any farmer or a friend, relative, family member, or well-wisher to report situations of extreme distress of a farmer to the Collector.

faqs.question: How Can The Family Of The Deceased Farmer Be Safeguarded From The Moneylenders?
faqs.answer: The RDO and his staff will get in touch with that family immediately and organize appropriate counseling at the District level.

faqs.question: Who Can Inform The Collectorate About The Situation Of Extreme Distress Of A Farmer?
faqs.answer: Any farmer or a friend, relative, family member, or well-wisher may bring to the notice of the Collector any situation of extreme distress.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Objective Of The 'Special Grievance Day'?
faqs.answer: The Special Grievance Day shall be held at the Collectorate once a month for farmers to cover all issues including farmer suicide, distress, government schemes, and land issues.

faqs.question: When Was The Government Order Of The Scheme Guidelines First Issued?
faqs.answer: The Government Order of the Scheme Guidelines was first issued on 14th October 2019.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objectives are to support the family members of deceased farmers/tenant farmers who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons.

faqs.question: Who Shall Be The Point Of Contact At The Collector’s Office In Case Of Suicide By A Farmer?
faqs.answer: A Point of Contact at the Collector’s office of the rank of Superintendent shall be designated as in charge of farmer suicide cases.

faqs.question: How Will The Suicide By The Farmer Affect His/Her Family's Prioritization For The Government Schemes?
faqs.answer: Benefits of other government schemes should be provided on a priority basis to the family members of the deceased farmer.

faqs.question: By When Is The District Collector Expected To Visit The Place Of Occurrence And For What Purposes?
faqs.answer: The District Collector shall visit the place of occurrence to extend moral support and initiate further necessary action.

faqs.question: What Additional Documents Are Required In Case The Suicide Is Committed By A Tenant Farmer?
faqs.answer: Documentary evidence of the lease such as Revenue Records or Crop Cultivators Rights Card (CCRC).

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Composition Of The Mandal Level Committee?
faqs.answer: The Mandal Level Committee shall comprise the Tahsildar as Chairman, Agricultural Officer as Convener, and Sub-Inspector of Police as Member.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Composition Of The Division-Level Committee?
faqs.answer: The Division-level Committee comprises R.D.O./Sub Collector as Chairman, Asst. Director of Agriculture as Convener, and Deputy Superintendent of Police as Member.

faqs.question: By When Should The Mandal-Level Committee Furnish Their Preliminary Report To The Divisional Level Committee?
faqs.answer: The Mandal-level Committee shall furnish their preliminary report within 24 hours positively.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme A 'One Family, One Benefit' Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no such mention in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Are There Any Age-Related Criteria For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no age-related criteria mentioned.

faqs.question: Can A Domicile Of Telangana Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme State Sponsored Or Centrally Sponsored?
faqs.answer: This scheme is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme.
